definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: Cans looking at prime minister to grasp a cordage, is plucked at them up.
sentences.chinese: 只能看着相国抓着绳子，被他们拉上去。

sentences.english: After Duan Siying succeeded to the throne, he began to scramble for the power and profit with the Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 而段思英继位后，就开始和相国董迦罗争夺权利。

sentences.english: In ancient times, there was a prime minister named Shang Yang in the State of Qin. He was held in high regard by the King.
sentences.chinese: 古时候秦国有个相国叫商鞅，秦王非常器重他。

sentences.english: Hong Neung taught Cheung Sang the way to face the Ladys blaming.
sentences.chinese: 红娘教张生应对相国夫人的责备。

sentences.english: In ancient times, a personal letter from Chu Ying Yan to the country.
sentences.chinese: 古时候，有个人从楚国的郢都写信给燕国的相国。

definition: the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
senior provincial official in imperial China
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
same as 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] Book of History
Grand Servant in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
member of a monarch's inner ministerial circle (old)
Commandant of Justice in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
